result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew T Ross

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew T Ross appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Matthew T Ross.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense requests resolution date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew T Ross appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Matthew T Ross.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Matthew T Ross appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Matthew T Ross.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has discovery and just received an offer this morning. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew T Ross in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew T Ross appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KR.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Matthew T Ross in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew T Ross
Current: 206 Park Circle #6, Sun Prairie, WI 53590   (Effective: 07-19-2022)
Prior: 8531 North 107th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53224
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Matthew T Ross not in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-5-2022 @1p

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
05/30/22.    22RM028253
